intro: Galphimia grandiflora, commonly known as the yellow bonnet, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a woody stem and thrives in full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens. Galphimia grandiflora is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
